column3: str
Ah... Another visitor...
It would seem our guest has overstayed their welcome...<hex:02100103>Come, my love. Let us show <hex:02080DE905FF04>her<hex:FF04>him<hex:03> the way out!
Oh, <hex:022C0DFF07><hex:022903EB0203><hex:FF02> <hex:0203>. So good to see you...<hex:02100103>I've started anew as an adventurer, just as I promised.
Would that Avere could see me now...
But...how did I come to be in this place...?<hex:02100103>I remember falling... And a robed figure...
The art of true resurrection... A challenge even in this world, it would seem.<hex:02100103>The Traders' Spurn seemed promising, but inevitably renders the subject undead.
The magicks of Gridania proved equally ineffective, only pulling<hex:02100103>souls back from the brink of death, unable to reach beyond the veil.
Aether, the great catalyst. The building block from which all<hex:02100103>creation is born, capable of reconstituting flesh through sheer will.
Heh heh heh... How fortuitous that I should be pulled from oblivion to continue my<hex:02100103>work in this world. More fortuitous still that I should find so fine a specimen as her.
...Yet even that experiment ended in failure. Such a pity.
She was the key, and with the strength of her spirit I would have flung wide<hex:02100103>the gates of truth. I would have discovered the means to escape death. Immortality...
Morality is but an illusion, and <hex:02080CE905FF04>she<hex:FF03>he<hex:03> would dare preach its<hex:02100103>falsehoods to besmirch her spirit, to close her eyes to the truth.
Could <hex:02080CE905FF04>she<hex:FF03>he<hex:03> not see the girl lamented the veil of death?<hex:02100103>That she would have rejoiced to see it lifted?
Tracked me down, have you? It seems my subjects were not as sturdy as I hoped.
You stand before Nybeth Obdilord, necromancer and arbiter of life and death.
Mine is a noble art, the path to salvation of the body and soul.<hex:02100103>I have come too far to be stopped by the likes of you!
Even here they fail to understand...
Humanity yearns for salvation from the ravages of death...to cast off the fetters of mortality...
Would you not try to free those you hold most dear?
